hints_html:
A reminder that there are two equivalent definitions of the derivative. You can use either

\[\begin{aligned} f'(x) = \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{f(x+h)-f(x)}{h}\end{aligned}\]

or

\[\begin{aligned} f'(a) = \lim_{x \to a}\frac{f(x)-f(a)}{x-a}\end{aligned}\]

You at some point will want to consider rationalizing the numerator.

To find the domain consider which fractions do not make sense and where one cannot evaluate square roots.
hints_latex: You at some point will want to consider rationalizing the numerator.

To find the domain consider which fractions do not make sense and where
one cannot evaluate square roots.
hints_raw:
A reminder that there are two equivalent definitions of the derivative. You can use either

:<math>
f'(x) = \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{f(x+h)-f(x)}{h}
</math>

or

:<math>
f'(a) = \lim_{x \to a}\frac{f(x)-f(a)}{x-a}
</math>
You at some point will want to consider rationalizing the numerator.
To find the domain consider which fractions do not make sense and where one cannot evaluate square roots.
sols_html:
We proceed directly

\[\begin{aligned} f'(x) &= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{f(x+h)-f(x)}{h} \\ &= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}-\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}{h} \\ &= \lim_{h \to 0}\left(\frac{\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}-\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}{h}\right)\cdot \left(\frac{\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}{\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}\right)\\ &= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{1-2(x+h)^{2}-(1-2x^{2})}{h(\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}})}\\ &= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{1-2(x^{2}+2xh+h^{2})-1+2x^{2}}{h(\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}})}\\ &= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{1-2x^{2}-4xh-2h^{2}-1+2x^{2}}{h(\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}})}\\ &= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{-4xh-2h^{2}}{h(\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}})}\\ &= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{-4x-2h}{\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}\\ &= \frac{-4x-2(0)}{\sqrt{1-2(x+(0))^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}\\ &= \frac{-4x}{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}\\ &= \frac{-4x}{2\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}\\ &= \frac{-2x}{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}\end{aligned}\]

Lastly, the domain of this function is anywhere that \(\displaystyle 1 - 2x^{2} > 0\) as square roots cannot be evaluated for negative numbers and if the quantity were zero, then the derivative would have a zero denominator and so we want that the term inside the radical is strictly positive. This occurs when \(\displaystyle -1/\sqrt{2} < x < 1/\sqrt{2}\)

We could also have used the other formula

\[\begin{aligned} f'(a) &= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{f(x)-f(a)}{x-a}\\ &= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}-\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}}{x-a}\\ &= \lim_{x \to a}\left(\frac{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}-\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}}{x-a}\right)\cdot\left(\frac{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}}{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}}\right)\\ &= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{1-2x^{2}-(1-2a^{2})}{(x-a)(\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}})} \\ &= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{1-2x^{2}-1+2a^{2}}{(x-a)(\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}})} \\ &= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{-2x^{2}+2a^{2}}{(x-a)(\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}})} \\ &= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{-2(x^{2}-a^{2})}{(x-a)(\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}})} \\ &= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{-2(x-a)(x+a)}{(x-a)(\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}})} \\ &= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{-2(x+a)}{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}} \\ &= \frac{-2(a+a)}{\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}} \\ &= \frac{-4a}{2\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}} \\ &= \frac{-2a}{\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}} \end{aligned}\]

The domain is computed as in solution 1.
sols_latex:
We proceed directly

\begin{align*}
f'(x) &= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{f(x+h)-f(x)}{h} \\
&= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}-\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}{h} \\
&= \lim_{h \to 0}\left(\frac{\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}-\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}{h}\right)\cdot \left(\frac{\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}{\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}\right)\\
&= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{1-2(x+h)^{2}-(1-2x^{2})}{h(\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}})}\\
&= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{1-2(x^{2}+2xh+h^{2})-1+2x^{2}}{h(\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}})}\\
&= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{1-2x^{2}-4xh-2h^{2}-1+2x^{2}}{h(\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}})}\\
&= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{-4xh-2h^{2}}{h(\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}})}\\
&= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{-4x-2h}{\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}\\
&= \frac{-4x-2(0)}{\sqrt{1-2(x+(0))^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}\\
&= \frac{-4x}{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}\\
&= \frac{-4x}{2\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}\\
&= \frac{-2x}{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}
\end{align*}

Lastly, the domain of this function is anywhere that
$\displaystyle 1 - 2x^{2} > 0$ as square roots cannot be evaluated for
negative numbers and if the quantity were zero, then the derivative
would have a zero denominator and so we want that the term inside the
radical is strictly positive. This occurs when
$\displaystyle -1/\sqrt{2} < x < 1/\sqrt{2}$

We could also have used the other formula

\begin{align*}
f'(a) &= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{f(x)-f(a)}{x-a}\\
&= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}-\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}}{x-a}\\
&= \lim_{x \to a}\left(\frac{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}-\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}}{x-a}\right)\cdot\left(\frac{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}}{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}}\right)\\
&= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{1-2x^{2}-(1-2a^{2})}{(x-a)(\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}})} \\
&= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{1-2x^{2}-1+2a^{2}}{(x-a)(\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}})} \\
&= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{-2x^{2}+2a^{2}}{(x-a)(\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}})} \\
&= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{-2(x^{2}-a^{2})}{(x-a)(\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}})} \\
&= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{-2(x-a)(x+a)}{(x-a)(\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}})} \\
&= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{-2(x+a)}{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}} \\
&= \frac{-2(a+a)}{\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}} \\
&= \frac{-4a}{2\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}} \\
&= \frac{-2a}{\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}} 
\end{align*}

The domain is computed as in solution 1.
sols_raw:
We proceed directly

<math>
\begin{align}
f'(x) &= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{f(x+h)-f(x)}{h} \\
&= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}-\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}{h} \\
&= \lim_{h \to 0}\left(\frac{\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}-\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}{h}\right)\cdot \left(\frac{\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}{\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}\right)\\
&= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{1-2(x+h)^{2}-(1-2x^{2})}{h(\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}})}\\
&= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{1-2(x^{2}+2xh+h^{2})-1+2x^{2}}{h(\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}})}\\
&= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{1-2x^{2}-4xh-2h^{2}-1+2x^{2}}{h(\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}})}\\
&= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{-4xh-2h^{2}}{h(\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}})}\\
&= \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{-4x-2h}{\sqrt{1-2(x+h)^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}\\
&= \frac{-4x-2(0)}{\sqrt{1-2(x+(0))^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}\\
&= \frac{-4x}{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}\\
&= \frac{-4x}{2\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}\\
&= \frac{-2x}{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}}
\end{align}
</math>

Lastly, the domain of this function is anywhere that <math> \displaystyle 1 - 2x^{2} > 0 </math> as square roots cannot be evaluated for negative numbers and if the quantity were zero, then the derivative would have a zero denominator and so we want that the term inside the radical is strictly positive. This occurs when <math> \displaystyle -1/\sqrt{2} < x < 1/\sqrt{2} </math>
We could also have used the other formula

<math>
\begin{align}
f'(a) &= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{f(x)-f(a)}{x-a}\\
&= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}-\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}}{x-a}\\
&= \lim_{x \to a}\left(\frac{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}-\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}}{x-a}\right)\cdot\left(\frac{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}}{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}}\right)\\
&= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{1-2x^{2}-(1-2a^{2})}{(x-a)(\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}})} \\
&= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{1-2x^{2}-1+2a^{2}}{(x-a)(\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}})} \\
&= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{-2x^{2}+2a^{2}}{(x-a)(\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}})} \\
&= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{-2(x^{2}-a^{2})}{(x-a)(\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}})} \\
&= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{-2(x-a)(x+a)}{(x-a)(\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}})} \\
&= \lim_{x \to a}\frac{-2(x+a)}{\sqrt{1-2x^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}} \\
&= \frac{-2(a+a)}{\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}+\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}} \\
&= \frac{-4a}{2\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}} \\
&= \frac{-2a}{\sqrt{1-2a^{2}}} 
\end{align}
</math>

The domain is computed as in solution 1.
statement_html:
Full-Solution Problem. In this question, justify your answer and show all your work. Simplification of numerical answers is required.

Using the definition of the derivative, compute \(\displaystyle f'(x)\) if \(f(x) = \sqrt{1 -2x^{2}}\). Also, specify the domain of \(\displaystyle f'(x)\).

No marks will be given for use of differentiation rules, but you may use them to check your answer.
statement_latex:
\textbf{Full-Solution Problem.} In this question, justify your answer
and \textbf{show all your work}. \textbf{Simplification of numerical
answers is required.}

Using the definition of the derivative, compute $\displaystyle f'(x)$ if
$f(x) = \sqrt{1 -2x^{2}}$. Also, specify the domain of
$\displaystyle f'(x)$.

\textbf{No marks} will be given for use of differentiation rules, but
you may use them to check your answer.
statement_raw:
'''Full-Solution Problem.''' In this question, justify your answer and '''show all your work'''. '''Simplification of numerical answers is required.'''

Using the definition of the derivative, compute <math>\displaystyle f'(x) </math> if <math> f(x) = \sqrt{1 -2x^{2}}</math>. Also, specify the domain of <math> \displaystyle  f'(x) </math>.

'''No marks''' will be given for use of differentiation rules, but you may use them to check your answer.
